title.narrative: OUTPUT 15: PRIMARY EDUCATION

description.narrative: Effective and inclusive teaching and learning practices modelled in primary education, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more girls and boys in Ghana are supported to complete quality and inclusive basic education with improved learning outcomes

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Effective and inclusive teaching and learning practices modelled in primary education

description.narrative: NICEF’s support has mainstreamed ‘Differentiated Learning’ (Targeted Instructions/Universal Design for Learning) principles in Government’s In-service Training Structure (INSET), and informing scaling across 10,235 schools in Ghana.;; Theformative research findings dissemination on identification and support for children with learning difficulties in early grades in Ghana targeted at both global and national audience reaching about 200 audience, and best practices upscaled at both pre-tertiary and pre-service levels. ;;The community library project using mobile vans to promote reading reached 3,500 early graders in 2 regions (eastern/central).;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/01/2022
